import pymel.core

BEAST_RENDER_LAYER_NAME = 'layer1'

class beastnamespace:
        def __enter__(self):
                namespacename=':beasttemp'
                self.oldnamespace=pymel.core.namespaceInfo(currentNamespace=True)
                if not pymel.core.namespace(exists=namespacename):
                        pymel.core.namespace(add=namespacename)
                pymel.core.namespace(set=namespacename)
        def __exit__(self, type, value, traceback):
                pymel.core.namespace(set=self.oldnamespace)
        @classmethod
        def cleanup(cls):
                pymel.core.delete(pymel.core.general.ls('beasttemp:*'))

class scopedprogressbar:
        def __init__(self, progressBar):
                self.progressBar = progressBar
        def __enter__(self):
                self.progressBar.beginProgress()
        def __exit__(self, type, value, traceback):
                self.progressBar.endProgress()

def createFileTexture(filename, uvscale, uvbias):
        with beastnamespace():
                f = pymel.core.nodetypes.File()
                uv = pymel.core.nodetypes.Place2dTexture()
                attribs = ["coverage", "translateFrame", "rotateFrame", "mirrorU", 
                                        "mirrorV", "stagger", "wrapU", "wrapV", "repeatUV", "offset",
                                        "rotateUV", "noiseUV", "vertexUvOne", "vertexUvTwo", 
                                        "vertexUvThree", "vertexCameraOne"]
                for attrib in attribs:
                        getattr(uv, attrib).connect(getattr(f, attrib))
                uv.outUV.connect(f.uv)
                uv.outUvFilterSize.connect(f.uvFilterSize)
                uv.coverage.set([1 / uvscale[0], 1 / uvscale[1]])
                uv.translateFrame.set([-uvbias[0]/uvscale[0], -uvbias[1]/uvscale[1]])
                f.fileTextureName.set(filename)
                pymel.core.namespace(set=':')
                return f

def createIlluminationDisplayShader(lightmapnode):
        with beastnamespace():
                l = pymel.core.nodetypes.Lambert()
                lightmapnode.outColor.connect(l.color)
                #l.color.set([1, 1, 1])
                return l

def createFullshadingDisplayShader(originalshader, lightmapnode):
        with beastnamespace():
                m1 = pymel.core.nodetypes.MultiplyDivide()
                lightmapnode.outColor.connect(m1.input1)
                originalshader.color.connect(m1.input2)
                m2 = pymel.core.nodetypes.MultiplyDivide()
                m1.output.connect(m2.input1)
                originalshader.diffuse.connect(m2.input2X)
                originalshader.diffuse.connect(m2.input2Y)
                originalshader.diffuse.connect(m2.input2Z)
                p1 = PlusMinusAverage()
                m2.output.connect(p1.input3D[0])
                originalshader.incandescence.connect(p1.input3D[1])
                displayshader = type(originalshader)()
                pymel.core.copyAttr(originalshader, displayshader, ic=True, ksc=True, oc=False, v=True)
                p1.output3D.connect(displayshader.incandescence, f=True)
                displayshader.color.disconnect()
                displayshader.color.set([0, 0, 0])
                displayshader.rename(originalshader + "_displayshader")
                return displayshader

class TargetResult:
        def __init__(self, atlasOffset, atlasScale, passResults):
                self._atlasOffset = atlasOffset
                self._atlasScale = atlasScale
                self._passResults = passResults
                
        def getAtlasOffset(self):
                return self._atlasOffset

        def getAtlasScale(self):
                return self._atlasScale

        def getPassResults(self):
                return self._passResults

def getBakedTextures(instance):
        targetsDict = {}
        entities = instance.beastEntities.get()
        for entity in entities:
                targetID = entity.target.get()

                atlasOffset = entity.outAtlasOffset.get()
                atlasScale = entity.outAtlasScale.get()

                passResults = {}
                for result in entity.textureResults:
                        passName = result.p.get()
                        passResults[passName] = result.textureFileName.get()
                targetResult = TargetResult(atlasOffset, atlasScale, passResults)
                targetsDict[targetID] = targetResult

        return targetsDict

def removeBeastRenderLayer():
        renderLayerName = BEAST_RENDER_LAYER_NAME
        if pymel.core.general.ls(renderLayerName):
                renderLayer = pymel.core.PyNode(renderLayerName)
                if renderLayer is not None:
                        # delete existing render layer, we first have to make it not current
                        defaultRenderLayer = pymel.core.PyNode('defaultRenderLayer')
                        defaultRenderLayer.setCurrent()
                        print 'BEAST: Deleting existing render layer', renderLayerName
                        pymel.core.general.delete(renderLayerName)
        beastnamespace.cleanup()

def createBeastRenderLayer(passName):
        renderLayerName = BEAST_RENDER_LAYER_NAME
        removeBeastRenderLayer()
        print 'BEAST: Creating new render layer', renderLayerName
        renderLayer = pymel.core.rendering.createRenderLayer(name=renderLayerName, makeCurrent=True, g=True)
        instances = pymel.core.general.ls(transforms=True)
        print 'BEAST: Creating Beast UV-sets for all instances'
        pymel.core.beastCreateUVSet(instances)
        textureCache = {}
        uvChooserCache = {}
        print 'BEAST: Creating materials for all instances'
        progressBar = pymel.core.windows.getMainProgressBar()
        progressBar.setMaxValue(len(instances))
        progressBar.setStatus('BEAST: Adding result display materials')
        with scopedprogressbar(progressBar):
                for instance in instances:
                        progressBar.step(1)
                        # find instances that have a Beast entity associated with them
                        if len(instance.beastEntities.get()) > 0:
                                # create override shader
                                if len(instance.shadingGroups()) > 0:
                                        results = getBakedTextures(instance)
                                        if len(results) > 0:
                                                entity = instance.beastEntities.get()[0]
                                                targetId = entity.target.get()
                                                result = results[targetId]
                                                lightmap = None
                                                shadingGroup = None
                                                textureCacheKey = result.getPassResults()[passName][0]
                                                if textureCacheKey not in textureCache:
                                                        lightmap = createFileTexture(result.getPassResults()[passName], (1.0, 1.0), (0.0, 0.0))
                                                        oldshader = instance.shadingGroups()[0].surfaceShader.inputs()[0]
                                                        displayshader = createIlluminationDisplayShader(lightmap)
        #                                               displayshader = createFullshadingDisplayShader(oldshader, lightmap)
                                                        with beastnamespace():
                                                                sg = pymel.core.sets(renderable=True, empty=True)
                                                                pymel.core.surfaceShaderList(displayshader, add=sg)
                                                                pymel.core.sets(sg, forceElement=instance)
                                                                textureCache[textureCacheKey] = (lightmap, sg)
                                                        #pymel.core.rendering.editRenderLayerAdjustment(instance.shadingGroups()[0].surfaceShader)
                                                        #beastLambert = pymel.core.PyNode('lambert1')
                                                        #displayshader.outColor.connect(instance.shadingGroups()[0].surfaceShader, force=True)
                                                else:
                                                        (lightmap, shadingGroup) = textureCache[textureCacheKey]
                                                        pymel.core.sets(shadingGroup, e=True, forceElement=instance)
                                                place2dTexture = pymel.core.general.listConnections(lightmap.uvCoord)[0]
                                                uvChooser = None
                                                if textureCacheKey not in uvChooserCache:
                                                        with beastnamespace():
                                                                uvChooser = pymel.core.general.createNode('uvChooser')
                                                                uvChooser.outUv.connect(place2dTexture.uvCoord, force=True)
                                                                uvChooserCache[textureCacheKey] = uvChooser
                                                else:
                                                        uvChooser = uvChooserCache[textureCacheKey]
                                                shape = instance.getShape()
                                                uvSetIndex = 0
                                                uvSetMatch = targetId + '(' + str(instance.instanceNumber()) + ')'
                                                for uvSet in shape.uvSet:
                                                        if uvSet.uvSetName.get() is None:
                                                                continue
                                                        if uvSetMatch in uvSet.uvSetName.get():
                                                                break
                                                        uvSetIndex = uvSetIndex + 1
                                                # TODO: some error checking on resulting uvSetIndex?
                                                # check if shape with this UV-set is connected already
                                                connectedToUVSets = pymel.core.general.listConnections(uvChooser.uvSets, plugs=True)
                                                if shape.uvSet[uvSetIndex].uvSetName not in connectedToUVSets:
                                                        shape.uvSet[uvSetIndex].uvSetName.connect(uvChooser.uvSets[uvChooser.uvSets.evaluateNumElements()])
